name: Psycholinguistics and Teaching and Learning French as a Second Language
description: An introduction to the study of the main psychological factors that influence the acquisition and use of French as a second language. To better understand the communication needs of the language learner, we will examine the learner's style (attitude, motivations, learning patterns) in relation to cognitive processes such as perception, production and memory. Emphasis on various teaching strategies. [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: LTL225Y5/FRE225Y5/FRE272Y5, FRE240H5, FRE241H5 (or FRE240Y5)/FRE280Y5 or a minimum grade of 77% in FSL406H5 or equivalent.
